```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>",
  strip.white=TRUE
)

library(casteval)
```


```{r juul_data}
# Here we have a list of 500 realizations of a forecast, each 150 days long
length(denmark2020ens)
denmark2020ens[[1]]

# We pass it to `create_forecast()` along with times and another information
fc <- create_forecast(
  list(time=0:149, ensemble=denmark2020ens),
  forecast_time=0,
  name="Denmark 2020 Juul forecast (May 5 to Oct 1)"
)

# We also have observations for roughly 50 days leading up to the forecast
tail(denmark2020obs)

# We can graph these two objects together
graph_forecast(fc, denmark2020obs)

# We can show confidence intervals
graph_forecast(fc, denmark2020obs, confs=c(95,90,50))
```
